author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) is preparing to deport the family of Boulder, Colo., attacker Mohamed Soliman’s wife and five children. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Secretary Kristi Noem said Tuesday that the family had been detained in connection with the investigation, saying they would face questioning over whether they had any knowledge of…
title: ICE prepares to deport family of Boulder attacker

author: Reps. Blake Moore (R-Utah) and Jimmy Panetta (D-Calif.), opinion contributors
description: Congress should support the bipartisan HOPE Act to empower over 100 million Americans to manage their health care expenses and promote better health outcomes.
title: America has a health care affordability gap. Congress is working toward change.

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: The Trump administration has notified California officials that federal funding for the state's high-speed rail project is at risk of being pulled after a four-month review concluding that the state has "no viable path" to complete the project on time or on budget.
title: Duffy threatens to pull California’s high speed rail funding

author: Tara Suter
description: The share of married LGBTQ Americans has slipped from its 2016-2017 peak, according to Gallup, as the court opinion allowing same-sex marriages approaches the 10-year mark. Between June 2016 and June 2017, 10.2 percent of LGBTQ Americans were in same-sex marriages, according to polling from Gallup. From 2021 to 2024, Gallup found 8 percent of…
title: Share of married LGBTQ Americans slips from 2016-2017 peak: Gallup

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Former United Nations Ambassador Nikki Haley (R) sharply criticized President Trump on Wednesday for suggesting Russia could play a mediating role in nuclear negotiations with Iran. “Russia has been receiving drones and ballistic missiles from Iran to use in its kidnapping of Ukraine,” Haley wrote in a post on X. “Iran and Russia are partners,”…
title: Haley on Trump call with Putin: ‘A backhanded slap to all of our allies’

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump on Wednesday doubled down on calls to scrap the nation’s debt ceiling, pressing for bipartisan action to abolish it and finding common ground with Democrat Sen. Elizabeth Warren (Mass.). “I am very pleased to announce that, after all of these years, I agree with Senator Elizabeth Warren on SOMETHING. The Debt Limit should…
title: Trump calls for scrapping debt limit

author: Jordan Unger
description: A New York man was found dead and his daughter remains missing after the pair went hiking over the weekend.
title: Father found dead, daughter missing after they went hiking on mountain in Maine

author: Danielle Langenfeld
description: According to the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS), the recalled products contain fish.
title: Jerky and snack sticks recalled nationwide

author: Sylvan Lane
description: Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-Mass.) and a CNBC anchor sparred Wednesday over the Federal Reserve’s decision to scrap an unprecedented penalty on Wells Fargo. In an interview with CNBC’s Sara Eisen, Warren blasted the Fed for lifting the asset cap it imposed on Wells Fargo in 2018 and urged the central bank to release its report…
title: Warren tussles with CNBC host over Wells Fargo, Fed

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Former Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice has described Russian President Vladimir Putin's behavior as "desperate" as Ukraine's drone strike against Russia's air bases demonstrates a shift in the war.
title: Condoleezza Rice: Putin getting more ‘desperate’

author: Andrew Dorn
description: More than 40% of Americans say tipping culture has become out of control, according to a new Bankrate survey.
title: Growing number of Americans say tipping culture is ‘out of control’

author: Andrew Dorn
description: On TikTok, crypto-influencers hype up lavish lifestyles, interviewing self-proclaimed Bitcoin billionaires surrounded by luxury cars.
title: Can you still make money with Bitcoin?

author: Jeffrey M. McCall, opinion contributor
description: Americans should all be concerned about the sad condition of higher education. Perhaps the saddest aspect of this decline is that the supposed intellectuals in charge of these colleges and universities have created this crisis themselves.
title: America’s DEI colleges get an ‘F’ on free expression

author: The Hill Staff
description: Federal Aviation Administration Acting Administrator Chris Rocheleau will testify Wednesday morning before the House Appropriations Committee on the agency’s fiscal 2026 budget request. The hearing comes as President Trump and Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy have stressed their goal of overhauling the FAA and investing in more modern technology and recruitment for air traffic controllers following…
title: Watch live: Acting FAA chief testifies before House on agency budget

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Vice President Vance on Tuesday jokingly rejected the “intellectual” label during a live interview at an event hosted by conservative think tank American Compass. The group’s founder, Oren Cass, welcomed the vice president to the stage, saying he’s “thrilled” to talk to Vance and is “in awe” of much of the work he’s doing “because…
title: Vance jokingly pushes back on ‘intellectual’ label: ‘You insult me’

author: Don Aviv and Jeremy Hurewitz, opinion contributors
description: Something is at work in America that is deeply disturbing and changing the threat landscape.
title: We’re in an era of ideological violence, and it’s only getting worse

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: President Trump’s steel and aluminum tariffs doubled on Wednesday to 50 percent, in a dramatic move aimed at protecting U.S. industries that economists say could increase prices for American consumers. The tariff hike on foreign metals went into effect just after midnight on Wednesday, and they apply to nearly all imports of steel and aluminum.…
title: Trump steel, aluminum tariffs taking effect

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: The Gavel is The Hill’s weekly courts newsletter. Sign up here or in the box below: Allies of President Trump are attempting a takeover of the D.C. Bar Association as voting ends Wednesday in the election to lead the prestigious organization.  The two-way race for president is between Diane Seltzer and Brad Bondi, the brother of…
title: Trump allies attempt DC Bar takeover

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: The Gavel is The Hill’s weekly courts newsletter. Sign up here or in the box below: President Trump and his allies are waging war with the Federalist Society as he sees parts of his second-term agenda blocked by some of his own judicial appointees. Simmering tensions broke into full public view after Trump called longtime Federalist…
title: Trump unleashes MAGA rebellion on Federalist Society

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: President Trump acknowledged the tough negotiation tactics of Chinese leader Xi Jinping as the U.S. reminds trading partners that the deadline for striking deals is approaching.
title: Trump: China’s Xi ‘extremely hard to make a deal with’

author: Elisha Maldonado, Opinion Contributor
description: More than a million people filled Tiananmen Square with a fragile hope that the system might bend. Instead, the system broke them.
title: When even remembering is a crime: China’s Tiananmen Square massacre, 36 years on

author: Anthony Ruggiero, Opinion Contributor
description: President Trump must now take further steps to protect Americans from the WHO’s counterproductive approach.
title: Trump must resist WHO’s pandemic power-grab

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: The educational research community is looking to pick up the pieces after the Trump administration has canceled dozens of studies and ended hundreds of jobs.   In line with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), hundreds of federal contracts have been canceled with education research groups, accused by the administration of either being useless or…
title: Education researchers struggle to pick up the pieces after Trump cuts

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Elon Musk on Tuesday threw a wrench into Senate Majority Leader John Thune’s (R-S.D.) ambitious plan to get President Trump’s “big, beautiful bill” passed by July 4, calling the legislative agenda passed by the House “pork-filled” and a “disgusting abomination.” Musk’s sharp criticism of the bill gives political cover to GOP fiscal hawks, such as…
title: Musk throws wrench into GOP’s plan to pass Trump’s ‘big, beautiful bill’

author: Jared Gans
description: New York Democrats are closing ranks around Gov. Kathy Hochul (D) in the wake of Lt. Gov. Antonio Delgado’s (D) decision to launch a primary challenge against her. Delgado and Hochul’s relationship has been on the rocks for a while, and many in the party expected the lieutenant governor to jump into the race.  Still,…
title: New York Democrats close ranks around Hochul amid deputy’s primary revolt

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: Republicans are seeking a major rollback of ObamaCare coverage under the House-passed megabill that would result in millions of people losing insurance coverage to help pay for President Trump’s tax cut extension. The changes, which echo some of the debate surrounding the 2017 effort to repeal the health care law, have largely flown under the…
title: Republicans seek ObamaCare rollback in Trump’s megabill

author: Julia Shapero
description: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) and Meta have wrapped up a six-week trial over the Facebook and Instagram parent’s alleged social networking monopoly, leaving the final decision in the hands of the judge.  The trial, which came to a close last week, seeks to determine whether Meta has a monopoly over personal social networking that…
title: What to know about the Meta trial as judge weighs decision

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump has fielded questions from the Oval Office in recent weeks about Elon Musk’s drug use, sensitive matters of diplomacy and the ethics of accepting a Qatari jet as a gift to be used as Air Force One. He’s chafed at some of those questions, but few set him off like the one he…
title: Why TACO trade gets under Trump’s skin

author: Mike Lillis
description: Conservative spending hawks in the House are worried about changes to the bill full of President Trump’s priorities that Republicans in the Senate are eyeing — and they may soon face a moment of reckoning. Under heavy pressure from Trump and his MAGA base, GOP spending hawks held their noses and voted last month to…
title: Worried House spending hawks could face moment of reckoning on Trump megabill

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: The Army has hit its annual recruiting goal of 61,000 new active duty soldiers, four months ahead of the end of fiscal 2025 in September, the service announced Tuesday. The Army said the goal – 10 percent higher than the 55,000 recruits it sought last year – “represents a significant turning point for the Army…
title: Army hits recruiting goal four months ahead of schedule
